You Might Be A Computer Geek If…

Posted by raymondlewallen on August 11, 2005

This is funny (via Jonathan Wood).  I’ve listed several of my favorites below, and which ones do and do not apply to me:

  • you’ve gutted and rebuilt your computer 5 times since you last changed the oil in your car (does not apply to me).
  • you know what a router is, and you know what a bit is, but you’ve never heard of a router bit (does not apply to me, as I actually own probably $300 in router bits).
  • you consider 65536 and 256 “nice round numbers” (this is me)
  • when asked if you have more than one hard drive, you answer “In which computer?” (this is me too)
  • if you HAS A job or you IS A human being. (this one might be above the heads of a few computer geeks, too.) (this was just funny, cause I know some programmers who wouldn’t get it)
  • your computer costs more and runs better than your car (does not apply to me)
  • you e-mail yourself notes rather than writing them… (yep)
  • …and you can justify the advantages of doing so. (yep again)
  • …or you actually reply to the note. (of course)
This entry was posted in Generalities. Bookmark the permalink. Follow any comments here with the RSS feed for this post.
